Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Jamesyglenboi
Reviews.Content: This place IS a little gem. Its in a great position, only 2 stops away on the metro from Las Ramblas, so smack in the middle of the city. It's clean, well appointed and wonderful bathrooms. No noise heard from the room. Advice from the staff was very helpful for a tourist in this wonderful city. Liked it so much have decided to go back again later this year (2012).

Reviews.Title: “A very good base for a lovely holiday”
Reviews.Author: randn94
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here. The location is quiet and safe and within good reach of bars, restaurants, metro, buses and sights. Don't be put off by the reported distance by some reviewers from the tourist centre, there is much more to wonderful Barcelona than Las Ramblas! The staff were friendly and very helpful. Thoroughly recommend upgrading to a suite with its many facilities. We would however have liked a more comfortable sitting area with some softer furnishings and even some pictures on the stark walls. Breakfast was acceptable, but not startling, and has both a coffee machine which, at times, seemed to have a mind of its own and a toaster which required four attempts to get successful toasted bread! We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet location with walkable distances.”
Reviews.Author: S R
Reviews.Content: Acevi Villarroel is a 4-star hotel in an excellent neighborhood, L'eixample. It is about 6 blocks from Paseo de Gracia - the main commercial/shopping area in Barcelona - in between two of Gaudi's best works on Paseo de Gracia, La Pedrera and Casa Batllo. We moved to this hotel from a different 4-star hotel from Las Ramblas because we wanted to be in an area where we would feel safe at night. Las Ramblas is an excellent area to shop and be a tourist during the day, but after 9pm even the taxi drivers told us it is not smart to be walking around. So Acevi was a hotel we found to be in a safe area still within a walking distance from all the major attractions. Our room was fantastic! It was a spacious king bed room that felt like a suite. The entrance was large and felt like a foyer instead. The bathroom sink was separated from the shower/toilet and that made it very comfortable. The hotel has great staff, all very friendly and willing to give advice. The wifi is free, which is a great feature not available at many hotels. If there are any drawbacks to the room it was probably the lack of large windows, but that is a recurring theme in many Barcelona hotels because of the proximity of the buildings. Overall, the rooms were very clean, though the attention to detail was not great. In other words, it is a well categorized 4-star hotel, not close to a 5-star hotel. The bar/restaurant "106" has great food for a good price. Finally, the price for the hotel was very reasonable for a 4-star, even though we booked it within a week of travel. The neighborhood was great as well. L'eixample has several bars and lounges for all types of people. It appears that there's a bar on each block, which gives tourists a great variety. The walk to Paseo de Gracia is only about 10-15 minutes. Perhaps a hotel closer to Paseo would be better, but you are unlikely to find one with a better price. Acevi was definitely a great hotel that we are likely to visit again in the future. It is good for couples and even children. The property is clean and quiet, and the surrounding neighborhood is comfortable, populated with several eateries and bars, and the walk to touristic areas is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, not a 4 star hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: Caro C
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3 nights. When we first arrive they treated really nice, but it was just for the first day. The room was big, I cannot deny that, and the bed was comfy, but apart from that, the room had nothing else to offer. The room could have been more decorated but it wasn't. The walls where white with nothing on them. The TVs where from the 90's (come on, even 3 star hotels have flat screens now!!). They offer you free wi-fi on their site, but it does not work once you arrive unless you sit on the floor next to your bedroom door or go to the reception. The bathroom could have been nice with more lights, but as they where just a few and didn't light up at all it wasn't. The cards on the room say that room service ends up at 11:30 PM. However, if you call at 10:30 PM they won't answer. When we got tired of waiting we went down to order our own food but they told us that the kitchen was closed (at 11:15). The breakfast was good, well, the food was, but the dishes where not washed very well. Sometimes you could find lefts over of food on them. Last but not least, on the last day, just before a taxi picked us up, they where so rushed for us to go that they took out our luggage (from the luggage room) and they did it with so little care that they broke one of my bags and didn't stop to say sorry. The location is good but I am pretty sure you can find a cheaper and better hotel closer to the city center or even the beach. I won't stay there any more.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, Hel[pful staff. Spacious. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: Edward w Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Centally located for major tourist areas. Safe, quiet location. Extremely helpful staff. Great value for the money. Have spent more in Barcelona on accomodation and recieved less! N.B.As you come out of the hotel if you turn left and walk down towards the metro there is the Balmes cafe cake and savoury pastry shop at No 78 Villarroel. An excellent little cafe with great pastries and teas. Ideal for a quick breakfast or pit stop.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JRBShlanko
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in a real neighborhood, 3 blocks from the metro and a nice break from the more touristed parts of Barcelona. Rooms are very clean and nicely appointed with a beautiful bathroom. Had a family room, which was 2 connected rooms and it was perfect. Other reviewers complained that the bathrooms had glass doors - it is frosted glass and you cannot see in. Staff is very helpful when we have questions. Would absolutely recommend it to any friends staying in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: froufrouBkk
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying in this hotel. It's 2 blocks from the metro, in a nice neighborhood, with clean, modern rooms. Overall, no complaints, it was a great mid-range/modern option. The smoke detector fell out of the ceiling one night which was strange, but otherwise everything else went smoothly. It has nice bathrooms, good bed, and friendly staff. There's a spa also, but we didn't use it as it cost 10 euros per person. Also had wifi, which worked very well during our 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ola Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: biusman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this very very nice hotel during our trip to Barcelona recently, and were looked after superbly. The staff were so friendly that we were treated as regulars . Ernest and David and the 2 girls at the front desk were excellent. June, the waiter at the restaurant helped us with train and bus routes and best restaurants in Barcelona . His advice on the T-10 tickets was great. We shall always remember him. The Hotel had bus routes to all parts of the city just outside the front entrence . There was even a train station just 5minutes away -URGELL STATION . Buses went straight to LA RAMBLAS from the hotel. The Buffet breakfast was good but could do with a little more variety, although I was very much satisfied with it. My wife had some adventurewith the coffee Machine as it didn't give her the precise coffee she wanted but he's loved the Peach juice every morning. I had smoked salmon on toast every day for starters at breakfast. The waiter at breakfast always had a smile, I forget his name. The room was large, clean and fantastic, together with the fine bathrooms. All in all we had a lovely time at the Acevi Villaroell Hotel and when we go back to Barcelona this is the hotel that we shall stay in. Oh by the way Barcelona was FANTASTIC !!!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: Jazreb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Acevi in March and I really have no complaints about the place. The staff were extremely hospitable (in particular Jun and Earnest in the restaurant and the front desk respectably). Room was very clean. As for location, although it is a few minutes walk from the Metro, it's not too much of an issue. Furthermore there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel. As some reviewers have mentioned, the restaurant doesn't have too much of a spread, be it the buffet or the a la carte menu. This is not to say that the food they DO serve isn't good. All in all, great place to stay without spending a fortune. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: omega65
Reviews.Content: I has just returned from 3 nights in Barcelona and found the Acevi Villarroel a good base to explore from, the hotel is close to Metro stop Urgell (10 mins walk ). I found the rooms to be spacious and well appointed with a slick modern Spanish style or should that be modern Catalan style, either way the rooms are very nice with excellent bathrooms and kept very clean. Breakfast was of the light Spanish style with a little hot food as well - something for everybody to eat - only poor thing was the coffe machine was a bit hit and miss but somehow manager to fight it each morning for a full cup of coffe. ! I found reception staff to be OK but nothing special, on check in the reception staff pointed me off towards the lift to find my room without telling me what floor it was on - no room numbers displayed in the lift so took a punt on the second floor having a room number of 207 and I was right - outside the lifts on each floor the rooms are clearly singed so would have found my way to the right floor sooner or later.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler186605
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you are on a budget in wonderful barcelona. We had a super spacious room, large double bed, and sleek bathroom. Also had decent breakfast every morning. The location is pretty central, about 20 mins walk to top of ramblas or 2 stops from metro urgell which is a five min walk.The staff were helpful and friendly especially Ernest who helped us every evening find the restaurents we were going to dine in. I highly recommend Place de lacadamia near Juame, a fab eatery that wont break the bank. This city is a brill place to spend the weekend and when I return again I will be staying here again. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “What do you want more....”
Reviews.Author: 73Roland
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, quiet spacious rooms if you are not on the street side. Is the 3rd time I'm staying in this hotel over the last 6 years for me it is the base in Barcalona. 15 minutes walk to place catalunia

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel * Good Location * Walking distance”
Reviews.Author: XFisher
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet and safe neighborhood, away from the noise of the Ramblas and Gran Via. If you enjoy walking, the distance from the hotel to Plaza Catalunya, and the Ramblas is not excessive and you will enjoy the scenery. Also you can walk to the nearest Tour Bus Stop. Front desk persons were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Butterflyonocean
Reviews.Content: The location was good, walking distance to the subway station and close to some tourist attractions; it was located in a nice and quiet residential neighborhood. The room itself was on a small side, but clean; however, it had no theme, no paintings or anything on the walls, just a desk, chair, and tv, The bed had a plain white comforter which made the room very boring. There were no colors in the room at all. The bathroom was very clean. Staff were friendly and helpful and went out of their way to help us find things we were looking for in the city. Overall we had a pleasant stay, but I wouldnt call it a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service from the front desk”
Reviews.Author: anwwanderlust
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning before our room was ready and the desk clerk was very helpful in providing information on the area and things to do while we waited. We spoke to her a few more times during the stay as well as others who were always very courteous (and were gracious in allowing me to practice my Spanish!) The room was very large and well designed. Some of the detail work was a bit lacking, but not a big deal. The location is excellent, in downtown and near major metro stations as well as convenience stores and a newspaper stand.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel- location just ok.”
Reviews.Author: HolidayGalDublin
Reviews.Content: We really had a great stay here- the room was huge, really nice and really clean. Its a good hotel, staff were very nice. Only thin is that's its a good 20 min walk to the centre of the action - as in near the water. It really is a good hotel though, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: elmaslar
Reviews.Content: I revisited this hotel after 4 years and left diappointed. I had to use the shared toilets at the reception just because the toilet flush in the room was not operating. The technical service couldn't manage to solve the problem for a whole day and it only worked once after the repairment. The front desk was so comfortable when I complaint about the problem. "Things happen" was their only comment. If you lower your expectations to have a good service, this place is only convenient with it's perfect location. Silent, pleasant neighbourhood and very close to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: chas2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 days during my trip to spain. Room was large, very clean, huge bed, and a great bathroom. Train stop was about 3 blocks away. metro stop was urgell. All major attractions were literally two to three stops away on L1 train line. Staff was very helpful. Hotel had a nice pool. only draw back it closed at 8pm which i think its too early. They have a spa didnt used any of the services but the jacuzzi. To use jacuzzi was about 10 euros per day and its open late until 11pm but water is cold which defeats the purpose of using the jacuzzi. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again. New york 2011

Reviews.Title: “Very good for travelers with children”
Reviews.Author: Malaica
Reviews.Content: Very good location, near of the main spots (2 metro stops to Pl. Cataluna or Pl. Espanha), 20 min. walk to Casa Batló or Sagrada Familia). Good for family with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel shame about the terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: natalieabudhabi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August with 3 of my girl friends. Location is OK, but for 4 girls in heels we couldn't walk to any nightlife so we had to get taxis. The reception staff we no help whatsoever. If anything, they were rude and made us feel uncomfortable especially when checking out and over charging us for the mini bar, blaming us for items we hadn't had. The hotel is good for the price, breakfast is OK-what you would expect from a city hotel inclusive. The pool area is big but surrounded by houses so expect people to be looking over and noises. Rooms are great, cd player tv (although didn't work) bathtub, shower. The only problem was the see-through windows and the space around the door, not something you want your friend to see whilst you're on the toilet! Staff told us we had to pay to use the spa which we checked up on the following day to find out it was included!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Mandy C
Reviews.Content: We travelled for one night with two children 5 and 9 and this worked really well for us. We had two rooms with a connecting door and a separate television for the children's room which they loved. The rooms were spacious with private facilities for both rooms. There is also a pool which we loved, not deep so there was no need to worry so we could relax on loungers and watch them play! I would recommend this hotel for ease of location to the Metro and we walked to Las Ramblas. Loved it. The Cox Family 5th Sept 2011

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: mari99
Reviews.Content: The facilities were quite nice. The room was interesting, but a bit weird, and not so good if you were not traveling with a significant other. The bathroom had a glass door on it, and it did not lock. I would call the staff "professional," rather than "friendly," but I suppose this is what is expected at a nice hotel. Personally, I prefer friendly. Arrival was a nightmare, since there was no place to stop in front of the hotel in order to go in and find out where their free parking was. It turns out that it is in a basement in the back alley behind. This is all find, except for the stress of not being able to stop even temporarily in front of the hotel. Breakfast was not awesome for me, but better than the spreads at many hotels in Europe. I am spoiled by living and traveling in Asia, where most hotels have a breakfast spread that is 10 times huger, and included in the price. Continental breakfast just doesn't do it for me. I thought the location was good enough: a couple of blocks to the subway station, and walkable distance to areas with many restaurants. Some moron in the next room spent hours shouting into his cellphone, which is not the hotels fault, but it was disgusting! Wake up calls are a personal knock on the door, not a phone call. I thought that was kind of cool.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Barcelona, would choose a hotel with a different location next time!”
Reviews.Author: smlarsen
Reviews.Content: A bit far out from city-center. A 3 block walk to the metro. Not very populated area.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: minniethemooch
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel after midnight, having taken the airport bus to Urgell and walked for about 10 mins. Initially the person at reception was a bit off, presumably because of our late arrival but he chilled out very quickly. The hotel is clean, modern and had a really good size bedroom and bathroom. We left the next morning so didn't eat in the hotel or use the pool but I would definitely go there again if I could get the room for a good price - we paid somewhere between €115 and €120.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic duplex room perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: Jenny1142
Reviews.Content: loved our stay at this hotel, we booked a duplex room for 2 adults and 2 kids. Loads of space, with double bed upstairs and 2 singles downstairs. A great arrangement for a family. Easy walk to a metro station. Great little pool which was perfect for an afternoon cool off. Didn't eat at hotel, but loads of friendly little cafes around for breakfast pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: Simon C
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a family duplex - two singles downstairs, and upstairs to double, brilliant for families. Nice pool, especially after a mornings sightseeing. Didnt eat in restaurant, great bakery across the road and down a bit for breakfast, another one down the road and first left. 10 minutes walk to Urgell metro, we used T10 tickets, 10 trips, can be used by anybody, for about 7 euros. Bought snacks and drinks to put in minibar in room from local supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JeffS_Toronto
Reviews.Content: A good bargain. Nice, clean room with modern bathroom. Nice pool on the deck to cool down. Great location with lots to do and easy walking distance from many attractions. I'd stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: timWe
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on this hotel before I visited Barcelona I wasn't quite sure what to expect. However I have to say I was pleased. The room was excellent. Nicely proportioned, modern and very clean. I'd read a review of concern re the glass door to the bathroom and the large surround giving a view from the bedroom in to the bathroom. Not a problem for me. Facilities were good. Staff on reception were very helpful - except a little overloaded with check-outs on my last day. Nice pool area - yes overlooked - but so is a beach. Only downside was the restaurant - ate there twice in the evening - slow service and not good quality food - but there is an excellent restaurant just round the corner Excellent location. And YES even though I'm a very "picky" traveller I'd stay again. T

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city break hotel”
Reviews.Author: Truffyclover
Reviews.Content: Attractive minimalist style, well-maintained pool and quiet although centrally located. Staff were most helpful and sorted out flickering light bulb immediately. Computers on each floor for guests' use. 15 mins walk to centre and there's a bus stop opposite to take you to several attractions-frequent buses. Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “"Basic Hotel shallowest pool in the world"”
Reviews.Author: travelin4sure
Reviews.Content: Good location about ten minutes walk from Urgell Station(red line), perdominately a offices and residential area, lots of little shops next to and oppsite hotel and well priced. Hotel rooms are clean and well manged by housekeeping.We had room only so be careful if wanting to use the Spa/Swimming pool additional charges.Breakfast you are better of going out as it is cheaper and wider choice.Carlos at Reception very helpful but the female receptionist called Monest or monster was extremely rude and could not be bothered to polite civil very rude.

Reviews.Title: “Rather expensive for conditions, albeit centrally located”
Reviews.Author: bogdanprodan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located in a central area of Barcelona, within 15-20 minutes from either Placa D'Espanya or Placa Catalunya on foot. It is also easily reachable from the airport (and back) given the Aerobus Shuttle service that stops in Urgell station. On the other side of the story you may find the hotel has two types of rooms, in what seems to be a newer and an older part. We got a room in the old part and there was no WiFi coverage, although it was free! So we ended up taking trips to the lobby in order to access the internet. Room service was ok, not very generous with the soap and towels, they had a single small bottle of soap for two persons/day. We had to ask for more. Nothing about the food, we did not eat there, since the Cerveseria Catalunya was close enough and i'd never swap it for any other hotel menu.

Reviews.Title: “A great value for a good location with excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: skywaker9
Reviews.Content: I'll admit, we booked this hotel primarily because it seemed like a reasonable value for its location (after all, hotels are expensive in Barcelona). Once I arrived, I saw it was better than a good value for the location, it was an absolute steal. The staff was welcoming and very helpful throughout our stay. The rooms were simply phenomenal, we were upgraded to a 2-floor suite and it was excellent. The beds are nice, the furnishings top notch and it was certainly a great value. All of this a mere 15 or so minute walk from the Ramblas and in the middle of a great neighborhood (we ate most of our meals in the neighborhood during out 4-night stay). We will absolutely return to this hotel when we next visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: DanyaV
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel in Summer 2010. It's very well located - in15 minutes you can walk to La Rambla. Rooms are very good: full of light, well-designed in a modern style, with a comforatble beds. Restaraunt is also great: breakfasts are magnificient and atmosphere itself is positive. All staff is helpful and friendly. The only disadvantage is that there are not many good restaraunts located near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money considering its great location!”
Reviews.Author: DIY_Dave74
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located in l'Eixample area, 10 min walk to la Ramblas and with a Metro station close by for those who prefer not to walk. The room we got was very spacious, well decorated and overlooked the road to the front although the window was very small with a built in desk in front so there wasn't much of a view. WiFi was available free of charge in the room although the signal strength was weak. Room was cleaned to a high standard every day. Only downside I found with the hotel was the very limited menu in the restaurant (not much good if you don’t like fish/seafood!) although there were plenty of other restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “def not 4star”
Reviews.Author: funlovin19
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a med cruise and used this hotel for pre and post cruise nights. We booked a triple room for 3 adults and 1 infant but were given a double, we could barely move in the room as it was smaller than our ships cabin. By New York standards this room was tiny. Our view was that of a run down apt block not very nice. The night we arrived back from our cruise i finally got a tripleroom as per booking, but it was not very clean. The location was terrible about 15/20 min walk from La Rambla. We would never stay in this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Theresehols
Reviews.Content: Got a great price on this hotel from www.hotelsclick.com. It was in a quiet district just 2 metro stops from main plaza. Asked for a double room but was given a twin. Asked at reception for a double but only smoking rooms available. Room was on 7th floor at the back with view of rundown apartments with washing hanging from windows. Room was average size with large bathroom. On close inspection there was black scum around the tiles. The shower was a flimsy weak affair that took ages to work out how to use. Free wi fi in the room was very good. The breakfasts were pretty poor with limited choice.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good, shame about the details”
Reviews.Author: Xliga
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel, not very central but good area. Not too far from metro and buses. Staff were polite and helpful. Good sized clean room, comfortable beds but poor pillows. Air conditioning very noisy. Restaurant bright and cheerful. Enough to eat at breakfast but limited choice of cereals, fruit and bread, limited cooked food - scrambled eggs hard. Coffee, fresh oranges and toast were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ian10762
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay at this hotel but I would never recognise it from the comments in the previous review. The room we had was probably the best we've had on a city break. First class. The staff were friendly and helpfull. The breakfast was not Michelin Star but it was OK and set you up for the day. Location: about 15 to 20 mins from la Rambla. Same to the place De Espania in the other direction. Perfect If you use the very frequent Airport bus. It drops you off at the corner of Gran Via and Urgell. Cross the road and Carrer Vallarroel is the next block. The hotel is a few hundered metres up the road. Note the bus back does not stop at the same place but it's only one block down. The chap at the desk gave me a map and marked it on for me. Plenty of nice bars and places to eat in the area. Next time we go to Barcelona we will stay in this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: sashaz08
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to my stay at Acevi in Barcelona because of the great reviews that I had read online. When my fiance and I first arrived, we were impressed by the modern decor and convenient location of this hotel. However, our initial excitement wore off quickly as when we were greeted by a less than enthusiastic front desk agent. I felt like from the moment we arrived, the hotel staff just treated us both as a large inconvenience instead of guests at their supposedly four-star establishment. Instead of courtesy and smiles, we received blatant attitude and disrespect. The front desk staff did not give us much information about the hotel services- including breakfast times, breakfast cost/whether it was included in the package, spa location/amenities, and other useful information about the surrounding area. This information was also not available in the rooms. When I asked questions, I received exasperated sighs, eye-rolling, and often wrong information (we were told breakfast was included in our room package upon the first day of arrival and was quite surprised by the 150euro bill we got upon checkout). The experience at this hotel was not completely atrocious. The cleaning staff did an excellent job and our housekeeper was friendly. There was also one female front desk agent that provided us with useful information about the metro systems. However, I would not recommend anyone who places customer service high our their satisfaction list for hotels to ever stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very few facilities”
Reviews.Author: LondonLulu31
Reviews.Content: This is supposed to be a 4 star hotel. In my opinion it is not. The rooms are clean and the cleaner was excellent but we had a window handle missing from our window and the design of the bathroom door is not only see-through, it also has a gap all the way around it. Therefore, if you are hoping for a romantic weekend with a new partner, do not go here as you have no privacy in that department!! We couldn't get a cup of tea or coffee in the hotel - there were no facilities in the room, and unless the restaurant was open (God knows when this was open as we never saw it open) there was no chance. I needed an iron to iron my creased dress for a night out ,and was told by reception that this was not possible and that as housekeeping had left, they simply did not have one in he building! Not what I expect from a 4-star hotel. Lastly, we wanted to book a massage as the facilities were advertised. This was also impossible ,as it turns out that there was only a ' mobile masseuse' that had to be booked in advance, and actually this person never answered his phone all the time we were there. (really pointless advertising this facility as it does not exist) The staff were ok, but did not go above and beyond the basics and we heard the word 'impossible' too many times. They couldn't even recommend a coffee place nearby to make up for their lack of facilities. The spa costs £10 a day as well which is not advertised. I will say that the maid was great though and the room was clean at least.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice location, excellent in all respects”
Reviews.Author: KookieKo
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights at this hotel during thanksgiving week, 2010. The hotel looks newly renovated, the room that we got was huge (especially for European standards --just the bathroom alone was quite big and nicely designed; it felt like we were staying in a small apartment instead of a hotel). The location, in a nice neighborhood and just a couple of blocks away from public transportation, was very convenient. And what can one say about Barcelona... you have to love this wonderful city. We have visited this city every year since 2007 and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Brillant value for money”
Reviews.Author: DijanaZagreb
Reviews.Content: Stay for 6 nights on the end on october nad begining of november 2010. Found this hotel after a lot of online searching for a hotel within walking distance of Placa de Catalunya. The rooms were great –first night got big room on first floor for invalid person but it was cold and smelly wird in bathroom. So they make a change on reception in nice big room on fifth floor. Hotel is about a 15 minute walk from Las Ramblas and conviently located to many local restaurants and cafes. Billant value for money, and always restful place to come back to after a day of sight-seeing and an evening of tapas hunting. Didn't take breakfast; but plenty of cafes around for a a croissant and coffee, and easier to find a good corner restaurant. Room was of a very modern, minimalist, spotlessly clean design and had a good CD player / radio. No iron in room, no cooker for water in room, no slipper and robe towel in bathroom. Hamburger in room was terrible – do not order that, but spagetti carbonara was good. If you order taxi from hotel they charge you start more and also they have more expensicve tariffe on kmthey drive you. Free wifi with very good signal, good restaurant, nice toiletries, spacious rooms, quiet - would stay here again on next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value hotel close to the centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: BeeLeigh
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel after a lot of online searching for a hotel within walking distance of Placa de Catalunya and Las Ramblas but with parking. While they do charge around 20 euro a night for parking it is thier own parking area underneath the hotel and extremely secure. The rooms were great - we had one double room and a family room. The family room was an upstairs, downstairs configuration. Twin beds upstairs with a bathroom and downstairs a roll away bed and sofa bed with toilet. Strange that the toilet downstairs was not also a bathroom as there was plenty of room for a shower. Hotel is about a 15 minute walk from Las Ramblas and conviently located to many local restaurants and cafes. Free wifi, outdoor pool, good restaurant, nice toiletries, spacious rooms, quiet - would stay here again on our next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional staff! Rip off!”
Reviews.Author: TheTraveller65
Reviews.Content: Positive points...rooms are big, modern, want to be contemporary feel and good location if you want this area of Barcelona! Negative points...I cant stand unprofessional staff who dont know a thing about service and when i feel ripped off!!!! Breakfast was ok if you like things out of a can and scrambled eggs which are really runny. I would never knew about the poor unprofessional service the hotel offers if it were not for their "fitness centre". I am rather an easy low key guest and not demanding at all BUT this story I am about to share still makes me so mad one month after staying at this hotel! I booked this hotel because they advertise on bookings.com and their own website gym. When I arrived at the hotel I asked where the gym is and the hours. Then I came down to use the gym and the door was locked. I went to the reception and asked if I could use the gym. The reception informed me that the gym would cost 10 euros per day. I asked why this is not mentioned on their website or on bookings,com? The answer was the manager wanted to market the gym this way. When I went down to the gym and found the gym consisted of one running machine, and weight bench and a collection of free weights, Note they are missing some of the pairs of dumbells. So if you were looking for the 16kg weight you only got one! On top of it the weight bench was under the AC which was dripping water on the bench so I had to move the bench, When I went to the reception to complain they gave me some story that the gym is part of the so called spa. The spa is 2 dark treatment rooms, a dark and dingy whirlpool and sauna. For me this is totally wrong marketing and communication and to charge 10 EUROS per day for a running machine and some dumbells (not complete) is a total rip off. They reception said they would speak to the manager and see what he says. When I checked out they still did not remove the charge, The recpetion staff would not even LISTEN to me (age old rule ...listen to customer and customer is always right) They only wanted to argue with me and talk over me the entire time. The staff was rude, poorly managed and showed no empathy!

Reviews.Title: “Another Gem”
Reviews.Author: DougieG67
Reviews.Content: A friend of ours did the research on this hotel and booked it because it was close to some of the places we wanted to see, and because of recommendations he found on Trip Advisor. What a great find! It was a little bit off the beaten path for a "tourist hotel" but was definitely in the heart of things for where we wanted to be. There are several bars and clubs within easy walking distance, but not so close that you could ever hear any noise. Our room faced the street but we never heard any traffic until we actually opened the window. The size of the room was the most pleasant surprise as our room was actually almost a mini-suite. It had a sleeping area with the bed and side table and a small mini-bar, and then an entry hall with desk and the wash basin. The bathroom (with full bath and separate shower) was clean, and well appointed. The ONLY down side was that the AC in our room wasn't working extremely well, but then again it was september, so it was not as if we were sweltering. I mentioned it to the hotel staff and they said they would have it checked. GREAT experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean,spacious hotel in central location. Terrible swimming pool.”
Reviews.Author: Pogleswood6
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights on a city break with our kids (6 and 9). Hotel is near the metro, and about 15 minutes' walk through pleasant streets to the Ramblas. The hotel gave us two big, adjoining rooms. These were well furnished and clean. Bathrooms were well kitted-out, but one bath only had boiling hot water (just as well we had two bathrooms). Breakfast was generous, and a good mix of Catalan and continental food. We didn't bother with dinner and lunch there (who visits Catalunya for nachos and pasta?!) Swimming pool is a bit rubbish - small and completely overlooked by very scruffy and down-at-heel blocks of flats. My kids took one look at it and went "yuck".

Reviews.Title: “Clean & simple”
Reviews.Author: Neat10
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute, there was some confusion as we checked in bc they were not sure if it was pre paid on not (it had been). The room was very clean, floor boards, fully tiled bathroom. Room wasnt huge but big enough. The bed was the only let down as it was two singles pushed together! Was within walking distance to the metro and bus stops. Ten minute walk to Rambla. Happy with our choice!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great price and location”
Reviews.Author: Parushni
Reviews.Content: Acevi Is a good hotel for the price, comfort, location. In ten minutes you can walk anywhere or reach the metro stops. Very good connectivity. We could walk to la rambla easily everyday and to catalunya, passieg dr Garcia and the gaudi buildings. Had to take the train once, that too was very close. Big neat rooms, friendly staff. Only thing- bathroom door has no latch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, 10 minutes walk to downtown”
Reviews.Author: popab
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, close to major attractions of Barcelona. We had a standard triple room for 1 week, quite big (around 4 x 8 meters) and modern, marble bathroom, comfortable beds and pillows. A quit room but the hall noise still disturbing during the night (anyway, we had a good sleep). Nice breakfast altought I thing could be more diversified (I mean, it was the same menu day by day): salmon, blue cheese, champaign, natural fruit juice (orange, pineapple, peach) etc. We really enjoyed the sauna, turkish bath and the jacuzzi (were there three times). The staff was friendly and helpful. At the and of the day, it was a very pleasant stay, it's a real 4 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: PamHordon
Reviews.Content: Family rooms seem hard to find in most cities so when this one clicked up on the screen, it looked perfect, and the price even better! I was slightly concerned about the location as a lot of reviews said it was too far to walk and i'm not a fan of the Metro. We arrived to 2 very spacious & clean inter-connecting rooms, facing the back so we had no night-time noise from the street. The pool area was nice enough (yes it is overlooked by the surrounding flats). The staff were pleasant enough and spoke good english. The restaurant was on the expensive side and not a great choice, esp for children. We ate breakfast at a small bakery which was 2 mins away on the opposite side of the road (fantastic cafe con leche!). We walked to the Place de Catalunya in around 20 mins (with 2 children, 5 & 8) so it wasn't too far. Overall - a great hotel for families. I probably would not stay here if not travelling with children, I would stay more central (have previously stayed in the Gran Marina but they don't accept children!) but with children you can't find better, 10/10! The only negative, I found the very dark corridors a bit off-putting!

Reviews.Title: “Checked out immediately after 1 night. Don't bother with this one.”
Reviews.Author: tmelb
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a 4 star hotel by any stretch of the imagination. Very old and dated hotel with none of the services or level you would expect for a 4 star hotel. I had a terrible experience with the staff. They did not give me a room I had booked and promised to change rooms the next day. Next day they told me they could not change because they were fully booked (even though the hotel seemed absolutely dead). After some 'discussion', they then said they could change rooms. Yes, after they told me they didn't have any rooms! Then they said because of my smoking room request they could not change which was a complete lie because I had specifically requested a non-smoking room in my booking! No apologies either! I asked to speak to a manager but was told I could do it the next day. All in all, rude, horrible staff. Decided to check out and went to Hotel Jazz. Do yourself a favour and stay there. Some other things - Whilst there are 2 computer terminals on each floor, I had to go to every single floor to find one (and I could only find 1) that was connected to the internet. Also, the pool looks nice in photos but is on the second floor surrounded by residential apartments, so you would not want to sunbake there. Please stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “great value in a cute neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: drozowski
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful stay in this nice hotel. Nothing totally special - but certainly nothing wrong. The neighborhood was cute and the tapas at El Reloj was awesome. The rooms were very large - esp. for EU standards. Very clean & well appointed. The pool was small but clean and it was lov ely to rewind next to it after a long day of sight seeing. Breakfast was worth the price. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: naomi83
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner in March for four nights. The hotel was modern, clean and comfortable and looked exactly like the photos on their website. Our room was cleaned daily and had all the usual products you would expect of a four star hotel. On check in we were given a map and some tips about the places we were interested in visiting which was useful. I felt the staff were very knowledgable about the locality and seemed genuinely keen for you to enjoy your stay. As we didnt use the spa facilties and chose to eat out rather than use the hotel restaurant I am not able comment on those aspects of the hotel. However the computers on each floor with free internet access were a bonus and I think there was free WiFi too. The hotel was in the district of Eixample which is about 15 minutes from La Ramblas and about 5 minutes to the Urgell metro stop if you didnt fancy the walk. We found it to be a good base for exploring the city and had excellent links to the airport. The airport bus stopped outside Urgell on the way there and picks up from Avda Diagonel (5 mins from hotel at the top of C/Villaroel) on the return-especially good as this is before the main tourist area and pretty much guarantees you will get on and get a seat. I would recommend breakfast at a small bakery on C/Villaroel as you walk to the metro stop which did a coffee and a fresh pastry for 1.50eur. There was also an amazing ice cream parlour-Cremeria Toscana-which was on C/Muntanur very close to the hotel which is worth at least one visit! I would definitely return to this hotel again as I found all aspects of the hotel to be excellent, from the facilities and the location to the hotel staff and relaxing atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: zle_bp
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, metro station is just a few minutes walk. Rooms are very clean, modern and comfortable. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There is free internet access in the room, both wifi and cable. Breakfast is excellent, with a wide choice of food. The wellness facilities (pool, gym) are quite small (there are also sauna and steam), but were enough to have some relaxation at the end of the day. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: FoodandWineTonight
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, good location near center of city and near metro. The bilingual staff was very helpful, considerate, and caring. Free Internet provided on every floor. Swimming pool, spa, small workout room. 70 Euros for two people per night! The best rate in Barcelona for this class of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: viaggisaggi
Reviews.Content: Being here for a business meeting. We took several rooms and their conference center. The whole package was the best one i found in barcelona. Its style is the typical one now in vogue in most hotels in barcelona and spain: minimal design with class, practical and comfrotable. Rooms are good, service efficient, impeccable cleaning. good location

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosyjojo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a really lovely time. Our room was huge and had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. We were offered an upgrade for 10 euros per night but when we looked we didn't see much difference in the rooms so decided to stay where we were. We stayed in room 301 and aparanty this was a particulaly big standard room. The only problem we had during the stay was the noise from outside....the windows were not sound proof and we heard every passing car, siren or horn, which woke us up on a few occasions. The Jacuzzi area was nice, it was ideal to chill out after a day of walking. The location was good, the hotel was minutes from Urgell metro station and about a 15 min walk to The Ramblers. We were told by so many people to watch out for pick pockets, I didn't really feel too threatened by anyone and didn't hear of any stories where people has been targeted so just like anywhere you should be sensible with your bags etc. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveller1978
Reviews.Content: This is a smart, modern hotel in a good location in Eixample. It is a fair walk from the mainstream tourist centre, but a lot of good places to eat are in Eixample (such as Fast Good (Ferran Adria’s fast food place) and Tapas24, a well known modern tapas bar). On balance I would prefer to stay close to good places to eat than to sites. The hotel is also very conveniently located for the airport bus. The hotel has fairly decent free wi-fi and computers in public areas on each floor. We did not eat in the hotel so cannot comment on the food except to say that it did not appear to be a cheap option. In January it was too cold to use the pool. Our rooms were on the second floor so we cannot comment on the view from higher floors. We had no complaints about the hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: J_on_tour1
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to find fault with this high standard hotel. The rooms were modern, sleek, clean and tidy while the bathroom with an emphasis on glass and marble were even better. The beds and pillows were one of the most comfortable i have used. The fridge was well stocked with not just drinks and the air conditioning worked fine when we discovered and closed the most marginal of gaps in the window. There was a CD / DVD option that we didnt have time to use and the TV channels included BBC and ITV! The breakfast room was cool and spacious with the hot range of food consisting of scrambled / boiled eggs, thin sliced bacon, some unusual dish of vegetables and a local spicy sausage. The rest of the buffet bar included a good choice of breads, local cheeses, ham, a fish option, cakes and the usual fruit and cereals. We found all the staff friendly and helpful with the breakfast staff being enthusiastic about clearing the small rubbish away from the tables. We did not use the outdoor pool as the opening times were 10am - 8pm and we were never in before 7.30pm. There were two small grocery stores and a useful postbox (its the only one we saw) nearby with Urgell metro station 5 - 6 minutes stroll down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Noise next door”
Reviews.Author: alanfar
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in the Acevi Villarroel Hotel. Our initial impression of the establishment was positive: the reception staff were friendly and helpful and found us a 'quiet' room at the rear of the hotel on Floor 6. Spotlessly clean bed area and bathroom, serviced daily, with good, albeit standard, fittings and a free safe (some places charge up to 3Euros from reports I've read). There is no bar, which I think is a good thing, and whilst we didn't try the restaurant, both the evening dining and room service menus seemed reasonably priced, unlike the breakfast tariff which at 14Euros sounds outrageously expensive - like many before, we found a decent enough cafe further down the road on the opposite block where we were able to buy a Cafe con leche and croissant for 2Euros per person. The down side: whilst we could barely hear the traffic noise, our neighbouring room unfortunately was occupied by loud (or very deaf) people (who were obviously practising their tap dance routine on the wooden floor) with apparently little appreciation of either accoustics and other guests who might wish to go to sleep before 1.30 am! There was a locked link door to this adjoining unit, presumably intended to open to provide a family room for those with kids, which certainly didn't help, but the walls appeared to be of the standard (I hesitate to use the much-repeated phrase) paper-thin variety! The Urgell metro stop is a handy 2 minutes away and the bus service to the airport is excellent - just two blocks from the hotel and taking 20 minutes (4Euros each), so don't bother arranging a taxi. In summary, though the room noise didn't really spoil our break, it did rather detract from an otherwise good, well located hotel, and I wouldn't stay there again for that reason alone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrishWedding
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel where we were planning on exploring Barcelona. It is an excellent value for money hotel, spotlessly clean, facilities are good. We were very impressed with the free internet access on every floor. Most hotels you have to pay locally so this was good. The rooms were above average in my opinion. Bathrooms were particularly nice with v.good air conditioning in our room. The hotel pool was a bit small and they could do with a few more sunbeds at the pool, even if you don't go swimming, it was nice to sit by the pool and enjoy the sun. This hotel is about a 15min walk to the main city centre square/La Rambla, this is fine if you have 'comfy shoes', I didn't so thought the walk was a bit long until I purchased new shoes!!!!! Be prepared for a lot of walking in Barcelona but it was quiet an impressive city and the shopping is fantastic!!!! Overall, I would recommend the hotel and I would stay there again if I was going back.

Reviews.Title: “If you like Minimalism!”
Reviews.Author: jpgaudi
Reviews.Content: In some areas this hotel takes minimalism a little too far - a complete lack of drawer storage space in the bedroom and no character to the bedrooms - white blank walls with no pictures or adornments. There is also a shortage of plug sockets and quite what the socket 5 foot up in the middle of a blank wall is for we could not work out! The rooms themselves are clean and very functional although if you take a triple room and have a child with you (as we did) be prepared to fall over yourselves. We were spending a few days in Barcelona after a cruise and there was more storage and hanging space in our smaller cabin on the boat that there was in this hotel room. On the pictures the bathrooms looked fabulous - however what looks like marble is actually plastic tiles and some of the fittings are cheap and falling apart. The hot water regulator in our room didn't work properly and the shower only varied between hot and boiling - and changed of its own accord!! The hotel is however clean and pleasant and the staff friendly and helpful. The restaurant was good (the menu was a little limited) and reasonably priced. In positional terms its a little too far form Catalunya Square and Le Rambles - its an OK walk in the morning when you are fresh and its not too hot - but after a tiring day sightseeing its seems a long way back to the hotel. A bit off the beaten track and not in the most solubrious surroundings - not really positioned where we would expect a 4 star hotel to be. I would not rank this as a four star hotel (more like 3 and a half - we were never offered any help to get cases to and from our room and had to put them into and get them out of the storage cupboard ourselves). Really more a business man's hotel than a family hotel - you will be relatively comfortable here and we have stayed in far worse!

Reviews.Title: “loved the acevi villaroel”
Reviews.Author: gibby70
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend with a few friends, and had a lovely time. Hotel reception staff were so helpful and the rooms nice and clean. In a quieter area, but does not take long to walk to busier areas, like las ramblas. When it got hot it was really great to have the pool and just relax for a bit. Only negatives, probably not enough sunbeds and the pool is quite small. Overall would definately recommend it and if I go back to barcelona would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: bevjane
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at short notice for a three day break in Barcelona. It is situated in a quieter part of the city, about a 15 minute walk to the central square and the shops, bars and restaurant. This wasn't a problem though, as it was a pleasant enough walk. The hotel staff are very friendly and the rooms are beautifully clean and well furnished. There is free internet access provided with two computers on each floor. The breakfast selection in the dining room was not huge, but there was a varied selection of items available and we certainly had no complaints. I can recommend the chocolate pastries!! I would recommend this hotel. Nothing bad to say about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not really a design hotel”
Reviews.Author: InspirationLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 2 years ago and more or less the standard hasn't changed. Good location if you want to be in the Eixample, it's about 10 to 15 mins walk to Paseig de Gracia (for shopping) and Ramblas, but at night you'd want to use taxis to get around. Rooms are nice and comfy, even though they are starting to show the first signs of wear and tear (which is not that stilish to me). This time I tried the breakfast room (breakfast was included in the room rate): there's a good variety of food and nice wholemeal croissants (never seen these before), but not sure the whole lot is worth € 15,00 per person per day (if you have to pay it separately)? Pool is very small and the gym is tiny (more like a small area with free weights and a treadmill rather than gym). Still a good option if you just want to burn the extra calories from an evening out eating tapas :-). Overall a good hotel with good services and a decent standard, but don't expect the Hilton or Mandarin Oriental! :-D

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ceeceeAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We reserved parking at the hotel and even phoned the hotel to confirm this. Upon arrival the receptionist told us in a very rude and dismissive manner that the parking was full and that we'd have to park elsewhere. The elsewhere turned out to cost 23 euros a day and was quite far from the hotel. My husband then asked to see the manager who was even less accomodating and extremely unpleasant. She had a contradicting story and said that the parking had flooded. She also pointed out that a person should choose a hotel for the room and not the parking! There was also a terrible smell of sewage in the elevator which also filled our room and did not make for a very romantic ambiance (perhaps it was the flooded carpark.) At times there was no hot water and we ended up taking cold showers. We were all in all rather disappointed with the hotel and do not think it is worthy of 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad all round”
Reviews.Author: Elparaiso
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights based on tripadvisor reviews. The hotel is quite well located, a couple of minutes from Urgell metro stop and under 15 minutes walk from Las Ramblas. The room was modern, stylish and clean. It had a bath with shower and separate shower, which is great if you want to avoid a fight over who gets up first. We had a double room which was really a twin with two beds pushed together. Not the best but the beds were comfy enough. Made little use of staff at reception, but they were friendly and efficient and spoke good English. Did not take the breakfast as I found the 14 euro price a little rich. Happy enough to go out and get something elsewhere. Took a taxi to the airport at the end of my stay to avoid metro/train hassle and it came to 20 euros before tip. Overall happy enough with my stay, but it is not the cheapest accommodation for its class and if I return I will probably book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gillym32
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights from 1st - 4th February with a group of 8 girls. The hotel is lovely, modern, clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The only thing that upset us was that when we arrived at the hotel around 5.00 p.m. that we were told the kitchens don't open until 8.30 p.m. and we couldn't get anything at the bar or any room service. The kitchens are open from 7.30 a.m. to 10.30 a.m. then from 8.30 p.m. to 11.30 p.m.. In between those times there is no food available. We went out in search of somewhere to eat but there is not many restaurants around the area. The hotel itself is a 10-15 min walk to Las Ramblas when you get your bearings but the hotel ring for taxis for you and they are very cheap. The breakfast was nice with a great variety of foods both hot and cold. Plenty of bread, cakes, fruit, youghurt, cheese, meats, salmon, juices and cooked foods, e.g. omlettes, sausages, rashers, eggs. I tried some of the cooked foods and didn't really like them so I just stuck with toast, cheese & ham. The bar is quite small but the drink is very cheap. We had a few there before heading off to different locations. All in all I would stay there again but would prefer a hotel nearer the sites and within short walks of restaurants and bars etc.. We didn't use the spa or pool facilities. We tried to book some treatments before we went but were told there was no facilities. I think maybe the staff didn't understand us but there are lovely treatments available, we just didn't avail! We had to fly to Reus Airport as our flights were cancelled to Barcelona. We used the bus transfer from Reus to Barcelona for €20 return. The only thing was the bus company only put one coach on and that was full, they did organise a 2nd coach after about 20 minutes. Coming back on it the same thing happened and this was a bit of a mess and there was a delay too. We didn't miss our flight but it just added to the travelling times so I would definitely fly directly into Barcelona the next time I travel there. We went on the open top bus on the Sunday but the heavens opened and we didn't get to see many sites, but these things happen and we'll just have to return to see them again!!

Reviews.Title: “Flawless stay”
Reviews.Author: Raymondas
Reviews.Content: We made a booking having relied on previous reviews. It's great that our expectations were neatly matched by reality. Due to flight resheduling we arrived late at night and were warmly and promptly checked in. Despite the late hour the receptionist kindly advised us on places to visit and supplied us with the city map. The room itself proved to be modest but well kept. The bathroom was modern and cosy at the same time. Throughout our stay we were spending most our time exploring the city so we showed up at the hotel at nightime only and were always glad to find the room properly tidied. The hotel is situated a bit away from the main attractions so we had a good chance to have meals at several nearby non-touristy places and get soaked through with the city air. Getting to the center wasn't problem either - a nice 10 minutes by foot or approx. the same time by tube. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: Bluemilky1968
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated about 15 minute walk from Las Ramblas but there is a metro station 2 mins away with a direct line to the main tourist area.The hotel was very clean and the staff very helpful, although we did not use the spa or swimming pool there is free internet access on each floor for guests to use. Breakfast was ok but as it was not included in our booking it was expensive at 13 euros each. Our room was ok in size however the walls are very thin and you can hear everthing in the corridor but did not affect our enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay...”
Reviews.Author: DublinSar
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Acevi Villarroel where we had a very pleasant stay indeed. Certainly a hotel we'd recommend, thats located in a quiet area but within walking distance of Las Ramblas (about 15 mins) and very near a Metro stop called Urgell (5min stroll.) Lovely small bars and bakeries nearby with alot of restaurant choice in the area too (inc. a Vegetarian). Overall interior of the hotel was very positive with a clean, modern decor and friendly staff. The room was again very modern with a really comfortable bed which is a definite plus! On the downside however there was a really odd gap around the bathroom door which meant sharing the room can be an interesting experience (!!) a bad design flaw that sadly let the room down. This combined with the fact that the shower wasnt working (going hot and cold) for the 5 days we were there and even though we did tell the staff (twice) nothing was done to fix it! We would go back however as this was hopefully a once off experience!

Reviews.Title: “so classy!”
Reviews.Author: beccasparkles01
Reviews.Content: we booked here very last minute and ended up paying a lot to stay here but it was well worth it - a really lovely hotel! we'd come from a trip around older parts of europe and this hotel - although business orientated and on the outskits of the city - was fantastic. very new and clean, superior bathroom decor, beautiful bed, desk, flowers, mini bar etc. quite spacious and cool which was nice as barcelona was hot! it's quite a walk to the main part of the city but is fine if you enjoy walking...maybe 15 minutes to la rambla. we had a really nice time here although i would recommend trying to get a deal where breakfast is included - always a good bonus and we missed out!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: getzklein
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! I would have rated it excellent if it weren't for the location being a little out of the way. I wanted to stay up in this area to see how locals live, but there was nothing going on. It wasn't a very long walk to La Rambla, etc, but I wouldn't recommend this location to people who want to walk everywhere. The hotel itself was awesome. The rooms were modern, new and nice. The staff was polite and helpful. I was happy with everything and would recommend this hotel. We had the opportunity to stay in the Born district for our first few nights in Barcelone, but we stayed in L'Eixample district when we got back to town before flying home. I would highly recommend others areas to stay in first, eventhough this was a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and its location”
Reviews.Author: Deeliteful
Reviews.Content: We (a group of 4 women of "un certain age!") stayed here for 3 days. We loved the hotel. The rooms are lovely all glass and wood and the bathrooms are fab! The staff are very friendly and speak much better English than we do Spanish. Spa was great and the decking is lovely with really comfortable sun loungers around the pool (but - our only BUT - the pool is really shallow - less than a metre). We got a great rate via booking.com and it was worth every penny - great location - walking distance of Urgell Metro and even to Catalunya Sq (about 15-20 mins). Highly recommended. ****

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Acevi”
Reviews.Author: BandJH
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5-night stay at the Acevi Villarroel and it was first class. We got a great deal via asiarooms.com. The rooms are ultra-modern, spacious and clean. Even had BBC1 on tv and a cd/dvd player! The staff are friendly and helpful. The restaurant and bar are good and serve food until 11.30pm. Buffet breakfast was more than adequate with plenty of choice which was ideal as I am diabetic. Each floor has two computers with free internet access using fast broadband connections. The hotel is centrally located - just 2 metro stops from La Rambla. Don't forget to buy 10 metro tickets for a good saving. For an excellent and inexpensive meal try CafeMama on Carrer Doctor Dou. Would also recommend a day trip to the mountain top monastery at Montserrat. 19.50 euros for a combination ticket from the station at Pl Espanya which includes metro/train/cable car/funicular - brilliant!!

Reviews.Title: “Very, very good”
Reviews.Author: trollgutten
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a fairly quiet neighborhood. The reception staff is very helpfull. They recommended a restaurant called L'Olive(5 min walk from the hotel). It was excellent! If i go back to Barcelona i will stay at this hotel again:)

Reviews.Title: “Reached all expectations”
Reviews.Author: aquarius_em
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault it! This beautiful hotel has everything you could wish for from cleanliness to amenities, service was superb, restaurant was amazing. Having stayed and (previously) worked in hotels I have high expectations and this hotel reached it. If you like class you are in your element.

Reviews.Title: “Great ... for the nigthlife lovers!”
Reviews.Author: GiancarloRoma
Reviews.Content: Period: 20jul-23jul(3nigths) Price: €160,00 (per nigth - dbl) - LOCATION (5pts): just in the heart of the eixample area, few blocks from the nigthlife venues, walking distance from everything; - SERVICE (5pts): simple but efficient; - ROOM (5pts): modern design, pretty large (considering the price I paid); - BATH ROOM (3pts): it's ok ... but ... why do they use glass door for bathroom in Spain? - POOL (4pts): middle size but nice; - BUILDING (3pts): modern building in the eixample.

Reviews.Title: “great city!”
Reviews.Author: eddlemc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in accevi villarroel for five nights in June 2007. As a young couple, we were looking for somewhere relaxing, yet somewhere that was within walking distance of the city, and we were extremely happy with our choice! We found that the hotel lived up to everything that we had expected, and more! The hotel is situated in a lovely area, we felt extremely safe at all times of the day and night. we got the bus from the airport to the hotel, and it was very easy to find- using a great map that we got at tourist information at the airport. the room was fab- we were very impressed by the size of the room and the bathroom. the air conditioning was excellent and the bed was very comfy! We had a tv with a good selection of stations, a cd/ dvd player, and loads of little extras, from bottle openers to sewing kits! we found that the standard of cleanliness in the hotel was excellent. the pool is very small, and is surrounded by other apartments, but the sun deck is lovely, and it was so nice to be able to relax under the sun after a long day sight-seeing! the waiter service to the pool is excellent. we had six full days in barcelona, and we were kept extremely busy everyday as there is so much to do and see. the tourist bus, the bus touristic is excellent, and a two day pass is great value, as it is not possible to see everything in one day. Overall a great hotel,which we would definately recommend!

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel without hot water”
Reviews.Author: noonie4
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights nov.2006. Lovely rooms ,Lovely bathroom but no hot water when we needed it! This was very disappointing as you don't expect this in a 4 star hotel. The hotel have said that we may be entitled to a part refund! Will keep you posted!
